definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: One afternoon, a male devotee was chanting japa very loudly in the temple room.
sentences.chinese: 一天下午，一个男奉献者在庙堂里非常大声地念颂。

sentences.english: People in the street, ask crew-cut dignitaries asked in temple.
sentences.chinese: 平头百姓求于街头，达官显贵问于庙堂。

sentences.english: Ceremony was solemn temples burst of music began.
sentences.chinese: 仪式是在一阵庄严肃穆的庙堂音乐中开始的。

sentences.english: and repair the temple the storm collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 修建着风暴中倒塌的庙堂。

sentences.english: If they want to chant loudly, tell them to go into the temple room and chant before the deities.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们想大声念颂，叫他们去庙堂里在神像前念颂。

sentences.english: Someone once told me that we would build temples.
sentences.chinese: 有人这么说过，我们该修建庙堂。

definition: the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
state/country/the Gods of earth and grain
all levels of society/the imperial court and the ordinary people
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
to have reached the highest official positions
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
that being the case/then/in that case
